title: To me, accessibility feels like an afterthought in Pittsburgh development
subhead: This is the subhead for this story
author: Natasha Khan
body:
KeAnna, 32, lives in Homewood with her three children, Aubrey, 8, Christopher, 6, and Kaiden, 4.

This is their first home together in two years. KeAnna and her children were homeless, relying on family and friends to house them while they waited for a Section 8 housing voucher.

title: slide two
body:
KeAnna was eligible for a Section 8 voucher in Pittsburgh because she makes $38,000 a year and is the sole provider for a four-person household.

The Housing Choice Voucher Program, also known as Section 8, is a federal program that assists those in need of affordable housing by paying a portion of their rent.

title: slide three
body: It is common to wait on the Section 8 list for years. Housing Authority of the City of Pittsburgh must assess the eligibility of a backlog of thousands of applicants.
